metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7945 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenJPEG before r2908, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted PDF document, related to j2k.c, jp2.c, and t2.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120
No subscription required

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.1-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.1-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> openjpeg2 refactored some of the code

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu1.1120').
openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
